results.title: The Good Wife
results.brief_description: The Good Wife is a legal drama starring Emmy Award winner Julianna Margulies as a wife and mother who boldly assumes full responsibility for her family and re-enters the workforce after her husband’s very public sex and political corruption scandal lands him in jail.
results.description: The Good Wife is a legal drama starring Emmy Award winner Julianna Margulies as a wife and mother who boldly assumes full responsibility for her family and re-enters the workforce after her husband’s very public sex and political corruption scandal lands him in jail.

results.title: The Good Lord Bird
results.brief_description: Enslaved teenager Henry Shackleford, aka Little Onion, becomes a member in abolitionist John Brown’s motley family during the Bleeding Kansas era before the Civil War.

constellations_other.name: VFX to fantasy and freedom
constellations_other.description: Founded in Sydney, and now with offices worldwide, Animal Logic are an Academy Award-winning VFX and animation studio whose job is to bring the impossible to life. And they're in good company with these other artists and filmmakers.

results.description: Enslaved teenager Henry Shackleford, aka Little Onion, becomes a member in abolitionist John Brown’s motley family during the Bleeding Kansas era before the Civil War.
description_for_label: Enslaved teenager Henry Shackleford, aka Little Onion, becomes a member in abolitionist John Brown’s motley family during the Bleeding Kansas era before the Civil War.

results.title: The Good Fight
results.brief_description: Picking up one year after the events of the final broadcast episode of “The Good Wife”, an enormous financial scam has destroyed the reputation of a young lawyer, Maia Rindell, while simultaneously wiping out her mentor and godmother Diane Lockhart’s savings. Forced out of her law firm, now called “Lockhart, Deckler, Gussman, Lee, Lyman, Gilbert, Lurie, Kagan, Tannebaum & Associates”, they join Lucca Quinn at one of Chicago’s preeminent law firms.
results.description: Picking up one year after the events of the final broadcast episode of “The Good Wife”, an enormous financial scam has destroyed the reputation of a young lawyer, Maia Rindell, while simultaneously wiping out her mentor and godmother Diane Lockhart’s savings. results.title: The Godfather: Part II
results.brief_description: Both a prequel and sequel to The Godfather, Francis Ford Coppola’s follow up continues the modern-day tale of Don Michael Corleone (Al Pacino), alongside the story of young Vito Corleone (Robert De Niro) fleeing Italy and making his way through the mafia.

constellations_other.name: Evolution of colour
constellations_other.description: From stenciling film frames through to the survival of Technicolor after Hollywood stopped using it, this Constellation links early cinema to some of the world's greatest films.

results.description: In this sequel to “The Godfather”, set in 1940s-50s, Michael Corleone has taken over his father’s mantle as head of the powerful Mafia family. Director Coppola tells two stories - the roots and rise of a young Don Vito, played by Robert De Niro, and the ascension of Michael Corleone (Al Pacino) as the new Don. Throughout the film, flashback sequences shot in a neorealist style, parallel the two lives of father and son. A complex, epic vision of the corruption of American society, the film is widely considered to be as good as, if not better than the original. It won several Academy Awards including Best Picture, Director, Supporting Actor (DeNiro), Screenplay, Score and Art direction/set decoration.
description_for_label: In this sequel to “The Godfather”, set in 1940s-50s, Michael Corleone has taken over his father’s mantle as head of the powerful Mafia family. results.title: The Gleaners & I
results.brief_description: Varda focuses her eye on gleaners: those who scour already-reaped fields for the odd potato or turnip. Her investigation leads from forgotten corners of the French countryside to off-hours at the green markets of Paris, following those who insist on finding a use for that which society has cast off, whether out of necessity or activism.

results.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
results.creator_credit: Det Danske Filminstitut, Nordisk Film, ZDF, Yellow Bird, Film Capital Stockholm, Spiltan Underhållning, Nordisk Film & TV Fond, Svenska Filminstitutet, SVT, Film i Väst, Niels Sejer, Søren Stærmose, Niels Arden Oplev, Cilla Rörby, Nikolaj Arcel and Rasmus Heisterberg
results.brief_description: Swedish thriller based on Stieg Larsson’s novel about a male journalist and a young female hacker. In the opening of the movie, Mikael Blomkvist, a middle-aged publisher for the magazine Millennium, loses a libel case brought by corrupt Swedish industrialist Hans-Erik Wennerström. Nevertheless, he is hired by Henrik Vanger in order to solve a cold case, the disappearance of Vanger’s niece

constellations_other.name: Collective: investigative journalism on screen
constellations_other.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania that kills dozens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Det Danske Filminstitut, Nordisk Film, ZDF, Yellow Bird, Film Capital Stockholm, Spiltan Underhållning, Nordisk Film & TV Fond, Svenska Filminstitutet, SVT, Film i Väst, Niels Sejer, Søren Stærmose, Niels Arden Oplev, Cilla Rörby, Nikolaj Arcel and Rasmus Heisterberg

results.title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
results.creator_credit: Happinet Pictures, Kadokawa Pictures, Memory Tech, Q-Tec, Toki wo Kakeru Shôjo Seisaku Iinkai 2006, Madhouse, Sound Box, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Takafumi Watanabe, Jungo Maruta, Mamoru Hosoda, Yuichiro Saito and Satoko Okudera
results.brief_description: When 17-year-old Makoto Konno gains the ability to, quite literally, “leap” backwards through time, she immediately sets about improving her grades and preventing personal mishaps. However, she soon realises that changing the past isn’t as simple as it seems, and eventually, will have to rely on her new powers to shape the future of herself and her friends.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Happinet Pictures, Kadokawa Pictures, Memory Tech, Q-Tec, Toki wo Kakeru Shôjo Seisaku Iinkai 2006, Madhouse, Sound Box, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Takafumi Watanabe, Jungo Maruta, Mamoru Hosoda, Yuichiro Saito and Satoko Okudera

results.title: The Girl on the Train
results.creator_credit: Reliance Entertainment, DreamWorks Pictures, Marc Platt Productions, Amblin Partners, Erin Cressida Wilson, Ann Roth, Michelle Matland, Jared LeBoff, Marc Platt, Kevin Thompson and Tate Taylor
results.brief_description: Rachel Watson, devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day, until one morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

results.title: The Gang's All Here
results.brief_description: Playboy Andy Mason, on leave from the army, romances showgirl Edie Allen overnight to such effect that she’s starry-eyed when he leaves next morning for active duty in the Pacific. Song and dance hilarity follows.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

results.description: Playboy Andy Mason, on leave from the army, romances showgirl Edie Allen overnight to such effect that she’s starry-eyed when he leaves next morning for active duty in the Pacific. Only trouble is, he gave her the assumed name of Casey. Andy’s eventual return with a medal is celebrated by his rich father with a benefit show featuring Eadie’s show troupe, at which she’s sure to learn his true identity…and meet Vivian, his ‘family-arrangement’ fiancée. Mostly song and dance.

Mostly song and dance.

results.title: The Games
results.brief_description: The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

constellations_other.name: No guts, no glory
constellations_other.description: TV arrived just in time for the 1956 Melbourne Olympics. The Olympics crystallise ideas of nationalism, athletic heroism, and controversy, all of which have been explored through countless features, documentaries and TV shows.

results.description:
The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

‘The Games’ starred satirists John Clarke and Bryan Dawe along with Australian comedian Gina Riley and actor Nicholas Bell. It was written by John Clarke and Ross Stevenson. The series centred on the Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games and satirised corruption and cronyism in the Olympic movement, bureaucratic ineptness in the New South Wales public service, and unethical behaviour within politics and the media. An unusual feature of the show was that the characters shared the same name as the actors who played them, to enhance the illusion of a documentary on the Sydney Games.
description_for_label:
The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

‘The Games’ starred satirists John Clarke and Bryan Dawe along with Australian comedian Gina Riley and actor Nicholas Bell. It was written by John Clarke and Ross Stevenson. The series centred on the Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games and satirised corruption and cronyism in the Olympic movement, bureaucratic ineptness in the New South Wales public service, and unethical behaviour within politics and the media. An unusual feature of the show was that the characters shared the same name as the actors who played them, to enhance the illusion of a documentary on the Sydney Games.
